raw_text: for which a variety of automatic segmenters exist (e.g., Hearst 1997, Malioutov and Barzilay 2006, Eisenstein and Barzilay 2008, and Kazantseva and Szpakowicz 2011)

Three automatic segmenters were trained? or had their parameters estimated upon? The Moonstone data set, including MinCut; (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006), BayesSeg; (Eisenstein and Barzilay, 2008), and APS (Kazantseva and Szpakowicz, 2011)

Existing methods for topic segmentation typically assume that fragments of text (e.g. sentences or sequences of words of a fixed length) with similar lexical distribution are about the same topic; the goal of these methods is to find the boundaries where the lexical distribution changes (e.g. Choi (2000), Malioutov and Barzilay (2006))

Our model for disentanglement fits into the general class of graph partitioning algorithms (Roth and Yih, 2004) which have been used for a variety of tasks inNLP, including the related task of meeting segmentation (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006)
clean_text: Our model for disentanglement fits into the general class of graph partitioning algorithms (Roth and Yih, 2004) which have been used for a variety of tasks in NLP, including the related task of meeting segmentation (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006).

raw_text: In our problem, however, the solution is constrained bythe linearity of segmentation on transcripts ,similar to that in (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006)
clean_text: In our problem, however, the solution is constrained by the linearity of segmentation on transcripts, similar to that in (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006).

raw_text: In such a situation, a polynomial-time algorithm exists. Malioutov and Barzilay (2006) describe a dynamic programming algorithm to conduct topic segmentation for spoken documents
clean_text: Malioutov and Barzilay (2006) describe a dynamic programming algorithm to conduct topic segmentation for spoken documents.

raw_text: Malioutov and Barzilay (2006 )optimize a normalized minimum-cut criteria based on a variation of the cosine similarity between sentences
clean_text: Malioutov and Barzilay (2006) optimize a normalized minimum-cut criteria based on a variation of the cosine similarity between sentences.

raw_text: Our corpora do not include development sets, so tuning was performed using the lecture transcript corpus described by MalioutovandBarzilay (2006)
clean_text: Our corpora do not include development sets, so tuning was performed using the lecture transcript corpus described by Malioutov and Barzilay (2006).

raw_text: We evaluate the performance of APS on three tasks: finding topical boundaries in transcripts of course lectures (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006), identifying sections in medical textbooks (Eisen stein and Barzilay, 2008) and identifying chapter breaks in novels
clean_text: We evaluate the performance of APS on three tasks: finding topical boundaries in transcripts of course lectures (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006), identifying sections in medical textbooks (Eisen stein and Barzilay, 2008) and identifying chapter breaks in novels.

raw_text: We compare APS with two recent systems: the Minimum Cutsegmenter (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006) and the Bayesiansegmenter (Eisenstein and Barzilay, 2008)
clean_text: We compare APS with two recent systems: the Minimum Cut segmenter (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006) and the Bayesian segmenter (Eisenstein and Barzilay, 2008).

raw_text: Malioutov and Barzilay (2006) show that the knowledge about long-range similarities between sentences improves segmentation quality
clean_text: Malioutov and Barzilay (2006) show that the knowledge about long-range similarities between sentences improves segmentation quality.

raw_text: The first, com piled by Malioutov and Barzilay (2006), consists of manually transcribed and segmented lectures on Artificial Intelligence, 3 development files and 19test files
clean_text: The first, compiled by Malioutov and Barzilay (2006), consists of manually transcribed and segmented lectures on Artificial Intelligence, 3 development files and 19 test files.

raw_text: We compare the performance of APS with that of two state-of-the-art segmenters: the Minimum Cutsegmenter (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006) and the Bayesiansegmenter (EisensteinandBarzilay, 2008)
clean_text: We compare the performance of APS with that of two state-of-the-art segmenters: the Minimum Cut segmenter (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006) and the Bayesian segmenter (EisensteinandBarzilay, 2008).

raw_text: In situations where the document boundaries are unavailable or when finer segmentation is desired, automatic techniques for document segmentation may be applied (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006) .Synthetic meta data information may also be obtained via clustering techniques (Steinbach et al,2000)
clean_text: In situations where the document boundaries are unavailable or when finer segmentation is desired, automatic techniques for document segmentation may be applied (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006).

citing_paper_authors: Shafiq R., Joty | Giuseppe, Carenini | Gabriel, Murray | Raymond T., Ng
raw_text: While extensive research has been con ducted in topic segmentation for monologues (e.g., (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006), (Choi et al, 2001)) and synchronous dialogs (e.g., (Galley et al, 2003), (Hsueh et al, 2006)), none has studied the problem of segmenting asynchronous multi-party conversations (e.g., email)

citing_paper_authors: Shafiq R., Joty | Giuseppe, Carenini | Gabriel, Murray | Raymond T., Ng
raw_text: (MalioutovandBarzilay, 2006) uses the minimum cut model to segment spoken lectures (i.e., monologue)
clean_text: (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006) uses the minimum cut model to segment spoken lectures (i.e., monologue).

raw_text: Segmentation may be particularly beneficial when working with documents without overt structure: speech transcripts (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006), newswire (Misra et al, 2011) or novels (Kazantseva and Szpakowicz, 2011)
clean_text: Segmentation may be particularly beneficial when working with documents without overt structure: speech transcripts (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006), newswire (Misra et al, 2011) or novels (Kazantseva and Szpakowicz, 2011).

raw_text: Malioutov and Barzilay (2006) created a corpus of course lectures segmented by four annotators, noting that the annotators operated at different levels of granularity
